Apply withdrawn status to class list

Source: R/withdrawing.R
apply_withdrawn.Rd

Matches withdrawn students (from a parent or guardian withdrawal spreadsheet) to the corresponding students in a class list and marks them as withdrawn.

Usage

apply_withdrawn(
  class_list,
  withdrawn_students,
  school_link = "~/Wonde/Establishment_List_ID.xlsx",
  links_category = "Primary",
  expected_years = c(2019, 2020),
  do_log = FALSE
)

Arguments

class_list

Data frame of class membership data.

withdrawn_students

Data frame of withdrawal form responses, or path to an Excel file containing them.

school_link

Path to the school reference list Excel file.

links_category

Character vector of categories (for example "Primary") to filter the reference school list.

expected_years

Numeric vector of expected birth years to validate DoBs.

do_log

Logical; if TRUE, a log file ("Withdrawn_students.log") will be written.

Value

A list with two elements: * class_list: Updated version of the input class list with a Withdrawn? column. * withdraw: Data frame of withdrawal records, including match details and indices.

Details

The function attempts to find each withdrawn student within the provided class_list by matching on school name, first name, last name, and where available, date of birth. It handles various date formats and normalizes name casing and punctuation to ensure robust matching.

Matching is performed in this priority order: 1. Exact first and last name match 2. Partial first or last name match 3. Partial match on both names 4. First name and DoB match 5. Exact surname match only

The school name matching is handled by the internal function `.match_school_name()`.

See also

.match_school_name(), .process_withdrawn_dob()
